items.title: Part Enabler, Part Buffer: The Bind of the Justice Dept.’s No. 2
items.summary: Todd Blanche, the deputy attorney general, has helped usher in President Trump’s retribution campaign. But he faces anger on the right for resisting some of the most extreme measures.

items.title: Small Plane Crashes on Massachusetts Highway, Killing 2
items.summary: One person on the ground was injured when a plane crashed on a grassy highway median, forcing the closure of Interstate 195 in both directions in Dartmouth, Mass., officials said.

items.title: Miami Says Farewell to Its Seaquarium
items.summary: The aquatic park, a South Florida landmark for 70 years and also the subject of complaints over animal rights, drew visitors on Sunday before closing for good.

items.title: Originalist ‘Bombshell’ Complicates Case on Trump’s Power to Fire Officials
items.summary: As the Supreme Court seems poised to expand the president’s power, a leading scholar whose work the justices have often cited issued a provocative dissent.

items.title: Fragments of 2003 Cable Detail Torture in a Secret C.I.A. Prison
items.summary: An interrogator covertly used a power drill and handgun to menace a prisoner, without permission from the agency’s headquarters.

items.title: Dozens Rescued in Remote Alaskan Villages in Storm That Swept Away Homes
items.summary: The Coast Guard and the Alaska National Guard were conducting search-and-rescue operations in two villages along the Bering Sea on Sunday.

items.title: Obama takes aim at companies cutting deals with Trump: ‘We have capacity to take a stand’
items.summary: <p>Universities, law firms and businesses that have changed course should have stood by convictions, says ex-president</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/barack-obama">Barack Obama</a> took aim at institutions and businesses who made deals or worked out settlements with the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-administration">Trump administration</a>, noting on a new podcast episode: “We all have this capacity, I think, to take a stand.”</p><p>In a talk with Marc Maron on the comedian’s last edition of his long-running <a href="https://apnews.com/article/marc-maron-podcast-essential-episodes-williams-obama-7cf47716ed03728b7f1ce7ca73583c9f">WTF With Marc Maron</a>, the former US president said institutions – including law firms, universities and businesses – that have changed course during the Trump administration should have stood by their convictions.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/13/obama-trump-administration-deals-settlements">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Majority of special education staff in US education department laid off – report
items.summary: <p>Layoffs ‘decimating’ office responsible for protecting rights of infants, children and youth with disabilities, says worker</p><p>The majority of staff in the education department handling special education has been laid off, according to multiple reports.</p><p>Friday’s total of <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/10/federal-workers-pay-government-shutdown">466 layoffs</a> across the education department also impacted the Office of Special Education and Rehabilitative Services, which oversees programs that support millions of children and adults with disabilities nationwide, <a href="https://www.npr.org/2025/10/13/nx-s1-5572489/trump-special-education-department-funding-layoffs-disabilities">according to</a> sources speaking to various outlets.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/13/special-education-department-layoffs">Continue reading...</a>
